FlavorText: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

CardTextInHand: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
FlavorText: His mother said that he was just big boned.

CardTextInHand: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.
FlavorText: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

CardTextInHand: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
FlavorText: At least he has Angry Chicken.

CardTextInHand: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.
FlavorText: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

CardTextInHand: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
FlavorText: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

CardTextInHand: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.
FlavorText: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.
FlavorText: We will always remember you, "Defender!"

CardTextInHand: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.
FlavorText: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
FlavorText: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.
FlavorText: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

CardTextInHand: Combo: Deal 2 damage.
FlavorText: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When one of your minions dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
FlavorText: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

CardTextInHand: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
FlavorText: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

CardTextInHand: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.
FlavorText: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

CardTextInHand: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.
FlavorText: "Be Prepared" - Rogue Motto

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
FlavorText: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
FlavorText: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

CardTextInHand: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."
FlavorText: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
FlavorText: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

CardTextInHand: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.
FlavorText: Another one bites the dust.

CardTextInHand: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack.
FlavorText: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
FlavorText: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Charge; or +2 Health and Taunt.
FlavorText: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
FlavorText: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

CardTextInHand: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
FlavorText: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

CardTextInHand: Choose One - +5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.
FlavorText: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

CardTextInHand: Deal $3 damage. Overload: (1)
FlavorText: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

CardTextInHand: Deal $5 damage. Overload: (2)
FlavorText: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

CardTextInHand: Windfury. Overload: (2)
FlavorText: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

CardTextInHand: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
FlavorText: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

CardTextInHand: Overload: (1)
FlavorText: Yo, that's a nice axe.

CardTextInHand: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)
FlavorText: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

CardTextInHand: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
FlavorText: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

CardTextInHand: Taunt. Overload: (3)
FlavorText: Nothing beats rock.

CardTextInHand: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
FlavorText: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

CardTextInHand: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.
FlavorText: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

CardTextInHand: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
FlavorText: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

CardTextInHand: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
FlavorText: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

CardTextInHand: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.
FlavorText: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

CardTextInHand: Deal $10 damage.
FlavorText: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Freeze a character.
FlavorText: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

CardTextInHand: Spell Damage +1. Battlecry: Draw a card.
FlavorText: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
FlavorText: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
FlavorText: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
FlavorText: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
FlavorText: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

CardTextInHand: Can't Attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
FlavorText: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

CardTextInHand: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
FlavorText: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

CardTextInHand: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
FlavorText: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this minion and gain their Attack and Health.
FlavorText: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

CardTextInHand: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.
FlavorText: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

CardTextInHand: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.
FlavorText: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

CardTextInHand: Destroy all minions.
FlavorText: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
FlavorText: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

CardTextInHand: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
FlavorText: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

CardTextInHand: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
FlavorText: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.

CardTextInHand: Put 2 random Demons from your deck into your hand.
FlavorText: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.
FlavorText: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

CardTextInHand: Deal $2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
FlavorText: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
FlavorText: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

CardTextInHand: Silence a minion.
FlavorText: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

CardTextInHand: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
FlavorText: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

CardTextInHand: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
FlavorText: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

CardTextInHand: Copy 2 cards from your opponent's deck and put them into your hand.
FlavorText: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

CardTextInHand: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
FlavorText: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

CardTextInHand: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
FlavorText: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

CardTextInHand: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
FlavorText: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

CardTextInHand: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
FlavorText: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

CardTextInHand: Restore #8 Health. Draw 3 cards.
FlavorText: A grammatically awkward life saver.

CardTextInHand: Double a minion's Attack.
FlavorText: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.
FlavorText: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

CardTextInHand: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
FlavorText: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

CardTextInHand: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its cost.
FlavorText: C'mon Molten Giant!!

CardTextInHand: Whenever you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
FlavorText: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
FlavorText: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
FlavorText: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

CardTextInHand: Divine Shield. Taunt. Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.
FlavorText: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

CardTextInHand: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
FlavorText: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

CardTextInHand: Taunt. Enrage: +3 Attack
FlavorText: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

CardTextInHand: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
FlavorText: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

CardTextInHand: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
FlavorText: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

CardTextInHand: Enrage: +3 Attack
FlavorText: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

CardTextInHand: Taunt
FlavorText: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.
FlavorText: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

CardTextInHand: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
FlavorText: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

CardTextInHand: Taunt
FlavorText: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

CardTextInHand: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
FlavorText: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

CardTextInHand: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
FlavorText: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

CardTextInHand: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
FlavorText: Easily worth 50 DKP.

CardTextInHand: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
FlavorText: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

CardTextInHand: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
FlavorText: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

CardTextInHand: Enrage: Windfury and +1 Attack
FlavorText: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

CardTextInHand: Charge Enrage: +6 Attack
FlavorText: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

CardTextInHand: ALL other Murlocs have +2/+1.
FlavorText: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

CardTextInHand: Whenever a Murloc is summoned, gain +1 Attack.
FlavorText: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

CardTextInHand: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
FlavorText: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

CardTextInHand: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
FlavorText: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character.
FlavorText: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

CardTextInHand: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.
FlavorText: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

CardTextInHand: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
FlavorText: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

CardTextInHand: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
FlavorText: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

CardTextInHand: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
FlavorText: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

CardTextInHand: Charge
FlavorText: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

CardTextInHand: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
FlavorText: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

CardTextInHand: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
FlavorText: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
FlavorText: Why did it have to be snakes?

CardTextInHand: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.
FlavorText: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

CardTextInHand: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
FlavorText: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
FlavorText: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

CardTextInHand: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
FlavorText: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

CardTextInHand: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
FlavorText: Time to write some flavor text.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
FlavorText: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
FlavorText: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

CardTextInHand: Spell Damage +5
FlavorText: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
TargetingArrowText: Become a copy of a minion.
FlavorText: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

CardTextInHand: Windfury, Overload: (2)
FlavorText: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

CardTextInHand: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn and 4 Armor.
FlavorText: Chew your food!

CardTextInHand: Summon three 2/2 Treants with Charge that die at the end of the turn.
FlavorText: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

CardTextInHand: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.
FlavorText: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
FlavorText: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

CardTextInHand: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
FlavorText: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

CardTextInHand: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
FlavorText: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

CardTextInHand: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
FlavorText: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to your hero.
FlavorText: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Spell Damage +1.
FlavorText: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

CardTextInHand: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.
FlavorText: See?  Giant.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
FlavorText: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

CardTextInHand: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
FlavorText: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
FlavorText: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

CardTextInHand: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
FlavorText: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

CardTextInHand: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
FlavorText: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

CardTextInHand: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion and summon a 1/1 Imp.
FlavorText: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
FlavorText: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

CardTextInHand: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
FlavorText: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

CardTextInHand: Deal $1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
FlavorText: They're only smiling on the outside.

CardTextInHand: Your spells cost (1) less.
FlavorText: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
FlavorText: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

CardTextInHand: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
FlavorText: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

CardTextInHand: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand and it costs (2) more.
FlavorText: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
FlavorText: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

CardTextInHand: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each card played earlier this turn.
FlavorText: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

CardTextInHand: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
FlavorText: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

CardTextInHand: ALL minions cost (1) more.
FlavorText: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

CardTextInHand: Destroy a random enemy minion.
FlavorText: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

CardTextInHand: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
FlavorText: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

CardTextInHand: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
FlavorText: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

CardTextInHand: Restore #4 Health to ALL minions.
FlavorText: It isn't really a circle.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.
FlavorText: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

CardTextInHand: Deal $5 damage. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
FlavorText: Often followed by Holy Smokes!

CardTextInHand: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
FlavorText: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

CardTextInHand: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
FlavorText: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

CardTextInHand: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
FlavorText: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.
FlavorText: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.

CardTextInHand: Choose One - Draw 2 cards; or Restore 5 Health.
FlavorText: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

CardTextInHand: Windfury, Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt
FlavorText: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

CardTextInHand: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
FlavorText: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth.
FlavorText: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Destroy a Murloc and gain +2/+2.
FlavorText: Murloc.  It's what's for dinner.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.
FlavorText: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

CardTextInHand: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
FlavorText: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

CardTextInHand: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
FlavorText: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

CardTextInHand: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
FlavorText: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

CardTextInHand: Taunt. Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.
FlavorText: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

CardTextInHand: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
FlavorText: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1/+1.
FlavorText: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
FlavorText: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the "Pirate's Code".

CardTextInHand: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
FlavorText: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

CardTextInHand: Your other Pirates have +1/+1.
FlavorText: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.
FlavorText: "I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!"

CardTextInHand: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
FlavorText: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?

CardTextInHand: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
